events.originalText: NASA launched the space probe Voyager 1, currently the farthest spacecraft from Earth, from Launch Complex 41 at Cape Canaveral Air Force Station.
events.subtitle: NASA
events.headline: NASA launches Voyager 1 from Cape Canaveral Air Force Station

events.originalText: Squeaky Fromme (pictured), a devotee of Charles Manson, attempted to assassinate U.S. president Gerald Ford in Sacramento, California.
events.subtitle: Squeaky Fromme
events.headline: Squeaky Fromme attempts to assassinate President Ford in California

events.originalText: Hurricane Cleo dissipated after causing 156 deaths, mainly in Haiti, and causing roughly US$187 million in damages across the Caribbean and southeastern United States.
events.subtitle: Hurricane Cleo
events.headline: Hurricane Cleo causes 156 deaths and $187 million in damages

events.originalText: World War II: American and Australian airborne forces landed at Nadzab as part of the New Guinea campaign against Japan.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: American and Australian forces land at Nadzab in WWII

events.originalText: The Zimmerwald Conference, the first of three international socialist conferences forming the Zimmerwald movement, opened in Switzerland.
events.subtitle: Zimmerwald Conference
events.headline: Zimmerwald Conference opens in Switzerland

events.originalText: The Casablanca Fair (poster pictured) opened in the French protectorate in Morocco.
events.subtitle: Casablanca Fair of 1915
events.headline: Casablanca Fair opens in French Morocco

events.originalText: Under the mediation of U.S. president Theodore Roosevelt, the Russo-Japanese War officially ended with the signing of a treaty at the Portsmouth Naval Shipyard in Maine.
events.subtitle: Theodore Roosevelt
events.headline: Russo-Japanese War ends with treaty signed in Maine

events.originalText: A fire that killed 186 people broke out at the Theatre Royal, Exeter.
events.subtitle: Exeter Theatre Royal fire
events.headline: Fire at Theatre Royal, Exeter kills 186 people

events.originalText: A group of London schoolboys led by Bobby Buckle founded Hotspur Football Club to continue to play sports during the winter months.
events.subtitle: Bobby Buckle
events.headline: London schoolboys found Hotspur Football Club

events.originalText: Sam Houston (pictured) became the first popularly elected president of the Republic of Texas.
events.subtitle: Sam Houston
events.headline: Sam Houston elected president of Republic of Texas

events.originalText: Facing rising discontent in France, Louis XVIII was forced to dissolve the Chambre introuvable, the legislature dominated by Ultra-royalists.
events.subtitle: Louis XVIII
events.headline: Louis XVIII dissolves legislature dominated by Ultra-royalists

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: French naval forces handed Britain a major strategic defeat at the Battle of the Chesapeake (depicted).
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: French naval forces defeat Britain at Battle of the Chesapeake

events.originalText: In response to the British Parliament's enactment of the so-called Intolerable Acts, representatives from twelve of the Thirteen Colonies convened the First Continental Congress at Carpenters' Hall in Philadelphia.
events.subtitle: Parliament of the United Kingdom
events.headline: First Continental Congress convenes in Philadelphia

events.originalText: Swa Saw Ke was crowned the ruler of the Kingdom of Ava in Upper Myanmar.
events.subtitle: Swa Saw Ke
events.headline: Swa Saw Ke crowned ruler of Kingdom of Ava

events.originalText: Liu Yan declared himself emperor, establishing the state of Southern Han at his capital of Panyu (present-day Guangzhou) in southern China.
events.subtitle: Liu Yan (emperor)
events.headline: Liu Yan declares himself emperor of Southern Han in China
